com.analog.lyric.dimple.events

Class DimpleEventLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.dimple.events.DimpleEventLogger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDimpleEnvironmentHolder, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    @ThreadSafe
public class DimpleEventLogger
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable, IDimpleEnvironmentHolder
    Provides basic logging of dimple events.

    This class provides a simpler interface for than DimpleEventListener when you only want to print the text of events to an output stream.

    For instance, to log all dimple events to stderr for a graph fg, you only need to write: 

         DimpleEventLogger logger = new DimpleEventLogger();
     logger.log(DimpleEvent.class, fg);
    and to write to a specified file instead, you just need to open the logger with the given file, as in: 
         logger.open(new File("events.log"));
    The event logger will use the existing DimpleEventListener that is associated with the root graph of each event source, if it has been set. Otherwise, it will automatically set the root graph to use the listener DimpleEventListener.getDefault().
    Since:
    0.06

      • log

        public void log(java.lang.Class<? extends DimpleEvent> eventType,
       IDimpleEventSource... sources)
        Enable logging of given event type on specified targets.

        Enables logging by registering an event handler with the event listener of the environment creating a new one if necessary. It is assumed that all of the listed sources have the same environment.

        Parameters:
        eventType - is the superclass of the type of events that will be logged. If eventType is abstract then all subtypes will be logged, otherwise only that specific type will be logged.
        sources - lists the objects that should log events. This will affect both those objects and their children unless blocked.
        Since:
        0.06

      • logEntries

        public java.util.List<DimpleEventLogger.LogEntry> logEntries()
        Returns newly created list of current log entries for this object in no particular order.
        Since:
        0.06

      • unlog

        public int unlog(java.lang.Class<? extends DimpleEvent> eventType,
        IDimpleEventSource... sources)
        Removes log configuration of given event type on specified targets.

        Note that this will only remove logging set up for the same eventType and source combination. It will not block logging when log(Class, IDimpleEventSource...) was called on a parent object of the source.

        Parameters:
        eventType - is type used in a previous call to log(java.lang.Class<? extends com.analog.lyric.dimple.events.DimpleEvent>, com.analog.lyric.dimple.events.IDimpleEventSource...).
        sources - are one or more sources previously used with eventType in a previous call to log(java.lang.Class<? extends com.analog.lyric.dimple.events.DimpleEvent>, com.analog.lyric.dimple.events.IDimpleEventSource...).
        Returns:
        the number of log entries that were removed by this call.
        Since:
        0.06
